title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the relative extremum at x = 2

1 point is earned for the relative maximum with justification

f has a relative maximum at x = 2 because f' changes from positive to negative at x = 2.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the relative extremum at x = 2

1 point is earned for the relative maximum with justification

f has a relative maximum at x = 2 because f' changes from positive to negative at x = 2.

The student response earns one of the following points:

The student response earns all of the following points:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:

1 point is earned for appropriate increasing/decreasing and concavity behavior

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: g'(x) = f(x)

1 point is earned for the critical points

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

g'(x) = f(x) = 0 at x = 1, 3.

g' changes from negative to positive at x = 1 so g has a relative minimum at x = 1. g' changes from positive to negative at x = 3 so g has a relative maximum at x = 3.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for: x = 2

1 point is earned for the answer with justification

The graph of g has a point of inflection at x = 2 because g'' = f' changes sign at x = 2.
